title: Go Tell It on the Mountain - irony rests chiefly

content.question: The irony in the passage as a whole rests chiefly on the conflict between

choices.label: John's father's prophetic wrath and his mother's long suffering
the air of expectancy prior to the morning service and the sounds from the street
John's acute observation of religious ecstasy and his inability to participate in it
the change that takes place in the churchgoers on Sunday and their daily appearance and demeanor

content.answer: John's acute observation of religious ecstasy and his inability to participate in it

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the function of conflict in a text.
